Key Match Events: Indiana's Bennedict Mathurin and Myles Turner each recorded double-doubles.
Tyrese Haliburton capped his 17-point performance with a late 3-pointer as the Pacers held off the Orlando Magic 118-111.
Orlando played without injured star Paolo Banchero.
Franz Wagner scored a game-high 28 points for Orlando.
Orlando took a 97-96 lead on Anthony Black’s layup with 8:45 remaining.
Indiana responded with a 15-3 run, with Turner scoring seven of his 17 points during the burst.
Indiana's Haliburton made a clutch 3-pointer with 33 seconds left to secure the win.
Mathurin led the Pacers with 20 points and grabbed a team-high 11 rebounds.
Indiana had a 24-of-26 night at the free-throw line and shot 12-of-26 from 3-point range.
Orlando's Goga Bitadze recorded a double-double with 10 points and a game-high 12 rebounds.
